item.title: This Week at Remap
item.content:encoded:
A strange dynamic lately, where I'm still spending many hours in my evenings plucking away at video games, even though the podcasts I'm recording where I'm talking about video games will not include my thoughts on those games. Now, to be fair, several games I'm playing are straight up under embargo, so I can't chat about them anyway, but I'm thinking we might have to sneak in a bonus "what we've been playing" episode before our game of the year stuff wraps up. We'll see. Depends on how much progress we do/don't make on this week's podcast. Hope you're enjoying them!

-pk, who is also setting up a bunch of future interview pods, too

  • PODCAST: HOA – Rob has inherited a home full of inscrutable cable runs, a haunted DIY home-network environment, and venomous predators. His NAS isn’t speaking to his Roon client, and the whole thing is being powered by ISP-issued routers. In his darkest hour he turns to Brad Shoemaker and Will Smith of Brad and Will Made a Tech Pod for advice on fixing a home networking nightmare versus adapting to the nightmare, the right tools for the diagnostic jobs that lie ahead, and what should form the backbone of a modern smart home. Will also hard-sells Ubiquiti equipment, while Rob soft-pedals the Roon Nucleus.
  • STREAM: RV There Yet? – Look, at least we made it past a single goddamn checkpoint in the last stream. What more do you want from us??
  • STREAM: Motorsport Manager – I have no idea where Rob and Chia are at in their journey at the moment, but hey, why is that F1 movie nearly three hours?
  • PODCAST: Remap Radio – The game of the year podcasts continue, as we move into the upper half of everyone's lists, starting with number five.
  • ARTICLE: Letter Series – Fuck ICE, and fuck having to explain to my nine-year-old why there's a video of a guy getting shot on the house television.

Patrick Klepek (he/him) is an editor at Remap. In another life, he worked on horror movie sets, but instead, he also runs Crossplay, a newsletter about parenting and video games. You can follow him on Twitter, Threads, Mastodon, and Bluesky.
